meanings.sent1: After losing the game, he became even groutier and refused to talk to anyone.
meanings.sent2: She was groutier than usual after a long day at work.
meanings.sent3: Despite his groutier demeanor, his friends knew he was just feeling down.
meanings.sent4: The stormy weather matched his groutier mood perfectly.
meanings.sent5: Her groutier expression made it clear she was upset.

meanings.sent1: The groutier tiles in the bathroom needed to be cleaned thoroughly.
meanings.sent2: The groutier floor in the kitchen was difficult to keep clean.
meanings.sent3: The groutier walls in the shower gave the room a rustic look.
meanings.sent4: The groutier gaps between the tiles needed to be repaired.
meanings.sent5: The groutier surface of the mosaic added texture to the artwork.

meanings.definition: Showing a bad temper or mood
meanings.sent1: His groutier behavior during the meeting surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: She becomes groutier when she's hungry and needs a snack.
meanings.sent3: The groutier response from the customer service representative was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The groutier tone in his voice indicated his frustration.
meanings.sent5: The groutier attitude of the cat showed it was not in the mood for play.
